info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 6:55PM EDT until July 21 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Smyth and Tazewell.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen and additional rainfall is likely. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Clinch River, Georges Branch, Laurel Creek, Laurel Springs Creek, Crewey Branch, Big Creek, Beaver Creek, Campbell Creek, Coal Creek, Hungry Mother Creek, Comers Creek, Deans Branch and Indian Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion... Richlands... Broadford... Hungry Mother State Park... Adwolf... Claypool Hill... Raven... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING
